title: How to Make a Taco Bell Mexican Pizza

steps.headline: Get a skillet pan and place it over medium heat.
steps.description: Heat the ground beef and cook it until completely brown. Drain all excess oil.

steps.headline: Keep the beef in the pan.
steps.description: Add the chili powder, onions, salt, paprika, and water.

steps.headline: Stir and simmer for about 10 minutes.
While it's simmering, get a small frying pan and pour a little of cooking oil into the pan.
steps.description: Put it on medium heat. Place a tortilla into the pan, frying it for 30 to 45 seconds. Flip it over and fry that side for 30 to 45 seconds. Pop any bubbles that forms on the tortillas. You'll want to make sure that it always stays flat. Remove from the pan when it's golden brown and drain on paper towels. Repeat this step for each tortilla.

steps.headline: Cook and heat the refried beans in a separate pot.
steps.description: At this point also, you can go and preheat your oven to 400 °F (204 °C).

steps.headline: Grab one tortilla shell and spread a generous amount of beans on it.
steps.description: Scoop up some meat and then place another tortilla shell on top of the meat.

steps.headline: Pour about 2 tablespoons of salsa on top of the second tortilla.
steps.description: Spread cheese, onions, and tomato on the salsa.

steps.headline: Place the completed Mexican pizza in the oven for about 8 to 12 minutes.

text: Get a skillet pan and place it over medium heat. Heat the ground beef and cook it until completely brown. Drain all excess oil. Keep the beef in the pan. Add the chili powder, onions, salt, paprika, and water. Stir and simmer for about 10 minutes.  While it's simmering, get a small frying pan and pour a little of cooking oil into the pan. Put it on medium heat. Place a tortilla into the pan, frying it for 30 to 45 seconds. Flip it over and fry that side for 30 to 45 seconds. Pop any bubbles that forms on the tortillas. You'll want to make sure that it always stays flat. Remove from the pan when it's golden brown and drain on paper towels. Repeat this step for each tortilla. Cook and heat the refried beans in a separate pot. At this point also, you can go and preheat your oven to 400 °F (204 °C). Grab one tortilla shell and spread a generous amount of beans on it. Scoop up some meat and then place another tortilla shell on top of the meat. Pour about 2 tablespoons of salsa on top of the second tortilla. Spread cheese, onions, and tomato on the salsa. Place the completed Mexican pizza in the oven for about 8 to 12 minutes.
